channel.title: :wave: Hi there! on NarangLab
channel.description: Recent content in :wave: Hi there! on NarangLab

item.title: Excited State Dynamics and Open Quantum Systems
item.description: Challenge and Opportunity # Excited-state nanophotonics presents a critical challenge and opportunity as it involves competing degrees of freedom and constraints with coupled electrons, photons, and atomic structures.

item.title: Interactions with Molecules
item.description: Quantum Nature of Light # Chemical reactions are ubiquitous and play a critical role in everyday life.

item.title: Quantum Information Science
item.description: Our work in the quantum information subfield follows the integrated approach to quantum science embodied in the NarangLab.

item.title: Solid-State Spin Qubits
item.description: We have an active effort on how to model quantum defects in solids (“artificial atoms in solids”) such that we can guide the development of next-generation scalable quantum systems.

item.title: Topological Materials Science
item.description: Topological materials science has grown as a field of research within the last decade and it was recently reported that more than a quarter of all materials have topological features.

item.title: Short Course on 'Quantum Systems, Information, and Entanglement' by Dr. Spyros Tserkis
Mesoscopic finite-size effects of unconvential electron transport in PdCoO2
item.description: Georgios Varnavides⁺, Yaxian Wang⁺, Philip J. W. Moll, Polina Anikeeva, Prineha Narang, Phys Rev Materials 6, 045002 (2022)

item.title: Imaging phonon-mediated hydrodynamic flow in WTe2
item.description: Uri Vool⁺, Assaf Hamo⁺, Georgios Varnavides⁺, Yaxian Wang⁺, Tony X. Zhou, Nitesh Kumar, Yuliya Dovzhenko, Ziwei Qiu, Christina A. Garcia, Andrew T. Pierce, Johannes Gooth, Polina Anikeeva, Claudia Felser, Prineha Narang, Amir Yacoby, Nat Phys 17, 1216-1220 (2021)

item.title: Direct imaging and electronic structure modulation of moiré superlattices at the 2D/3D interface
item.description: Kate Reidy⁺, Georgios Varnavides⁺, Joachim Dahl Thomsen, Abinash Kumar, Thang Pham, Arhur M. Blackburn, Polina Anikeeva, Prineha Narang, James M. LeBeau, Frances M. Ross, Nat Commun 12, 1290 (2021)

item.title: Electron Hydrodynamics in anisotropic materials
item.description: Georgios Varnavides⁺, Adam S. Jermyn⁺, Polina Anikeeva, Prineha Narang, Nat Commun 11, 4710 (2020)

item.title: Prof. Prineha Narang
item.description: Prineha Narang is an Assistant Professor at the John A.
